description: Safely connect client to ZetaPush

name: createAsyncMacroService

name: disconnect
description: Disonnect client from ZetaPush

name: isConnected

name: getSandboxId

Set logging level

less verbose to more verbose.

name: getAsyncMacroPublisher

name: getHandshakeFields

name: getMacroPublisher

name: getUserInfo

name: handshakeFailure

name: isConnected

name: noServerUrlAvailable

Set logging level for CometD client
Valid values are the strings 'error', 'warn', 'info' and 'debug', from
less verbose to more verbose.

name: subscribe
description: Subsribe all methods defined in the listener for the given prefixed channel

name: updateServerUrl
description: Remove current server url from the server list and shuffle for another one

name: src/index.js
content:
export { Authentication } from './authentication/handshake'
export { ConnectionStatusListener } from './connection/connection-status'

export { Client } from './client/basic'
export { SmartClient } from './client/smart'
export { WeakClient } from './client/weak'

export { services } from './mapping'

/**
 * SDK Version
 * @type {string}
 */
export const VERSION = '3.3.0'

name: VERSION
description: SDK Version

name: src/mapping/authentications.js
Delegating
description:
End-user API for the delegating authentication

Provisionning verbs.

name: DEFAULT_DEPLOYMENT_ID
description: Get default deployment id associated to Delegating service

name: Simple
description:
End-user API for the simple local authentication

These API verbs allow end-users to manage their account.

name: DEFAULT_DEPLOYMENT_ID
description: Get default deployment id associated to Simple service

name: Weak
description:
User API for weak devices control

User API for control and release of weakly authenticated user sessions.

name: DEFAULT_DEPLOYMENT_ID
description: Get default deployment id associated to Weak service

name: control
description:
Controls a session

Takes control of a weak user session, identified by the given public token.
The public token has been previously made available by the controlled device, for example by displaying a QRCode.
Upon control notification, the client SDK of the controlled session is expected to re-handshake.

name: getToken
description:
Returns the current token

Returns your current session's private token. The token field may be null, if you did not log in with this authentication.
The token can be used to log in as the same weak user another time.

name: release
description:
Releases a session

Releases control of a weak user session, identified by the given public token.
The weak user session must have been previously controlled by a call to 'control'.

name: src/mapping/core.js
src/mapping/index.js
src/mapping/services.js
Aggreg
description:
User API for item aggregation

Users can push data and be notified of aggregated data.
This service does not allow you to read the data. To achieve that kind of behavior, you could configure a callback to store the data.

name: DEFAULT_DEPLOYMENT_ID
description: Get default deployment id associated to Aggreg service

name: push
description:
Pushes some data

Pushes the given data.
All the items are processed according to the defined rules.
At least one push for a given item is needed during a time period to trigger processing and calling of the corresponding callback verb/macro.

name: Stack
description:
Data stack user API

Data is stored on a per user basis. However, notifications can be sent to a configurable set of listeners.
Stack names are arbitrary and do not need to be explicitly initialized.

name: DEFAULT_DEPLOYMENT_ID
description: Get default deployment id associated to Stack service

name: getListeners
description:
Lists the listeners

Returns the whole list of listeners for the given stack.

name: list
description:
Lists content

Returns a paginated list of contents for the given stack.
Content is sorted according to the statically configured order.

name: purge
description:
Empties a stack

Removes all items from the given stack.

name: push
description:
Pushes an item

Pushes an item onto the given stack.
The stack does not need to be created.

name: remove
description:
Removes items

Removes the item with the given guid from the given stack.

name: setListeners
description:
Sets the listeners

Sets the listeners for the given stack.

name: update
description:
Updates an item

Updates an existing item of the given stack.
The item MUST exist prior to the call.

name: Echo
description:
Echo service

Simple echo service, for development purposes.

name: DEFAULT_DEPLOYMENT_ID
description: Get default deployment id associated to Echo service

name: echo
description:
Echoes an object

Echoes an object: the server will echo that object on channel 'echo' for the current user.

name: Game
description:
User API for games

Users can list, start, join games, and play.

name: DEFAULT_DEPLOYMENT_ID
description: Get default deployment id associated to Game service

name: available
description:
Lists game types

Returns the list of game types supported by the server and the currently registered game engines.

name: join
description: A user joins a game

name: organize
description: Organizes a game

name: play
description: Gives some command to the game engine

name: start
description: Starts a game

name: unjoin
description: A user cancels joining a game

name: GameEngine
description:
Game Engine API

The Game Engine API is for game engine clients, not end-users.

name: DEFAULT_DEPLOYMENT_ID
description: Get default deployment id associated to GameEngine service

name: join_result
description:
Notify the result for a join request

A Game Engine notifies the STR of the result of a join request that it received on join_callback

name: organize_result
description:
Notify the result for an organization request

A Game Engine notifies the STR of the result of an organization request that it received on organize_callback

name: register
description:
Registers a game engine

A client registers itself to the STR as a Game Engine.
The STR may, from now on, dispatch game of the given game type to said client.
Unregistration is done automatically on logoff.

name: start_result
description:
Notify the result for a start request

A Game Engine notifies the STR of the result of a start request that it received on start_callback

name: state
description:
Notify a game event

A Game Engine notifies the STR of some arbitrary game event.

name: unjoin_result
description:
Notify the result for an unjoin request

A Game Engine notifies the STR of the result of an unjoin request that it received on unjoin_callback

name: Gda
description:
GDA User API

User API for Generic Data Access.
The data are stored on a per-user basis.
Users can put, get, list their data.

name: DEFAULT_DEPLOYMENT_ID
description: Get default deployment id associated to Gda service

name: get
description:
Asks for a data row

Returns a full data row.

name: getCells
description:
Asks for a data cell

Returns a precise list of cells from a column in a data row.

name: inc
description:
Increments an integer value

Increments a cell 64-bit signed integer value and returns the result in the data field.
The increment is atomic : if you concurrently increment 10 times a value by 1, the final result will be the initial value plus 10. The actual individual resulting values seen by the 10 concurrent callers may vary discontinuously, with duplicates : at least one of them will see the final (+10) result.

name: list
description:
Asks for a list of rows

Returns a paginated list of rows from the given table.

name: put
description:
Puts some data into a cell

Creates or replaces the contents of a particular cell.

name: puts
description:
Puts several rows

Creates or replaces the (maybe partial) contents of a collection of rows.
This method only creates or replaces cells for non-null input values.

name: range
description:
Asks for a range of rows

Returns a paginated range of rows from the given table.
A range consists of consecutive rows from the start key (inclusive) to the stop key (exclusive).
You can specify partial keys for the start and stop fields.

name: removeCell
description:
Removes one cell inside a column of a row

Removes only one cell of the given column of the given row from the given table.

name: removeColumn
description:
Removes one full column of a row

Removes all cells of the given column of the given row from the given table.

name: removeRange
description:
Removes a range of rows

Removes the specified columns of the given range of rows from the given table.

name: removeRow
description:
Removes one full row

Removes all columns of the given row from the given table.

name: Remoting
description: User API for remote control

name: DEFAULT_DEPLOYMENT_ID
description: Get default deployment id associated to Remoting service

name: addListener
description:
Adds a listener

A user requests notifications from a device owned by anyone who granted him the right authorizations.
Whenever the device calls 'notify', notifications will be sent to the caller of this verb.

name: capabilities
description: Response to 'getCapabilities'

name: execute
description:
Executes a command

A user executes a command on a device owned by anyone who granted him the right authorizations.
The command is issued on channel 'command'

name: getCapabilities
description:
Requests capabilities

A user requests all his devices for the whole list of their capabilities.
Devices are expected to answer on channel 'capabilities'

name: notify
description:
Notifies of some event

A device notifies the registered users/devices on this channel.
The server forwards the notification to said users.

name: ping
description:
Pings devices

A user requests all devices (of all owners) on which he has authorizations to respond on channel 'pong'

name: pong
description: Response to ping

name: removeListener
description:
Removes a listener

A user stops requesting notifications from a device owned by anyone who granted him the right authorizations

name: GroupManagement
description:
User API for groups and rights.

Groups are stored per user.
This means that two users can own a group with the same identifier. A couple (owner, group) is needed to uniquely identify a group inside a group management service.
The triplet (deploymentId, owner, group) is actually needed to fully qualify a group outside of the scope of this service.

name: DEFAULT_DEPLOYMENT_ID
description: Get default deployment id associated to GroupManagement service

name: addMe
description:
Adds me to a group

Adds me (the caller) to a group.
This verb exists so that group owners may grant the right to join their groups without granting the right to add other users to those groups.
The 'user' field is implicitly set to the current user's key.

name: addUser
description:
Adds a user to a group

Adds the given user to the given group.
Addition may fail if the given group does not already exist.

name: addUsers
description: Adds users to a group

name: allGroups
description:
Lists my owned groups, with details

Returns the whole list of groups owned by the current user, with their members

name: createGroup
description:
Creates a group

Creates a group owned by the current user.
Group creation may fail if the group already exists.

name: delGroup
description:
Removes a group

Removes the given group owned by the current user or the given owner.
Also removes all grants to that group.

name: delUser
description: Removes a user from a group

name: delUsers
description: Removes users from a group

name: exists
description:
Tests for a group's existence

Returns whether a group exists or not.

name: grant
description:
Grants a right to a group

The granting API does not do any check when storing permissions.
In particular when granting rights on a verb and resource of another API, the existence of said verb and resource is not checked.

name: groupUsers
description:
Lists the group users

Returns the whole list of users configured inside the given group.

name: groups
description:
Lists my owned groups

Returns the whole list of groups owned by the current user

name: listGrants
description:
Lists rights for a group

This API lists explicitly configured rights.
Effective rights include configured rights, implicit rights and inherited rights.

name: listPresences
description:
Lists presences for a group

Returns the list of members of the given groups, along with their actual and current presence on the zetapush server.
The current implementation does not include information about the particular devices users are connected with.
If a user is connected twice with two different devices, two identical entries will be returned.

name: memberOf
description:
Tests membership

Tests whether I (the caller) am a member of the given group.
This verb exists so that users can determine if they are part of a group without being granted particular rights.
The 'user' field is implicitly set to the current user's key.

name: mgrant
description:
Grants rights to a group

Grant several rights at once.

name: mrevoke
description: Revokes rights for a group

name: myGroups
description:
Lists the groups I am part of

Returns the whole list of groups the current user is part of.
Groups may be owned by anyone, including the current user.

name: revoke
description: Revokes a right for a group

name: Httpclient
description: User API for http requests

name: DEFAULT_DEPLOYMENT_ID
description: Get default deployment id associated to Httpclient service

name: call
description:
Makes a predefined request

Lookups a predefined request by name, and executes it.

name: MacroDebug
description:
User API for macro debugging

Debugger API for macro.
These API verbs are not intended for use by most developers.

name: DEFAULT_DEPLOYMENT_ID
description: Get default deployment id associated to MacroDebug service

name: breakpoint
description: Enables or disables a breakpoint

name: info
description: Requests some information

name: livedebug
description:
Debugs a previously recorded macro

The given breakpoints will be honored, causing a suspension of the execution, resumable via 'resume'.
Only one debug session can be active at any given time.

name: resume
description: Resumes a paused macro

name: variable
description: Sets a variable value

name: Macro
description:
User API for macro execution

Simple errors are reported as usual.
However, the macro execution verbs treat most errors in a particular way : instead of reporting errors on the usual 'error' channel, errors are put in the returned 'MacroCompletion' result.
This behavior can be tuned on a per-call basis with the hardFail parameter.
Note that some particular errors will always behave as if hardFail were true, because they are related to programming errors, or prevent processing from ending gracefully : STACK_OVERFLOW, NO_SUCH_FUNCTION, RAM_EXCEEDED, CYCLES_EXCEEDED, TIME_EXCEEDED, QUOTA_EXCEEDED, RATE_EXCEEDED, BAD_COMPARATOR_VALUE

name: DEFAULT_DEPLOYMENT_ID
description: Get default deployment id associated to Macro service

name: call
description:
Plays a previously recorded macro

DO NOT use this verb from inside an enclosing macro when you need the result in order to proceed with the enclosing macro.
You can override the default notification channel when defining the macro.

name: Sendmail
description:
Mail service user API

This service is statically configured with an outgoing SMTP server.
Users call the API here to actually send emails.

name: DEFAULT_DEPLOYMENT_ID
description: Get default deployment id associated to Sendmail service

name: Messaging
description:
Messaging service

Simple and flexible user-to-user or user-to-group messaging service.

name: DEFAULT_DEPLOYMENT_ID
description: Get default deployment id associated to Messaging service

name: send
description:
Sends a message to a target

Sends the given message to the specified target on the given (optional) channel.
The administratively given default channel name is used when none is provided in the message itself.

name: Queue
description:
Producer / consumer real-time API

Task producers submits their tasks.
The server dispatches the tasks.
Consumers process them and report completion back to the server.
Tasks are global to the service (i.e. NOT per user).

name: DEFAULT_DEPLOYMENT_ID
description: Get default deployment id associated to Queue service

name: call
description:
Submits a task

Producer API.
A task producer submits the given task to the server.
The server will find a tasker with processing capacity and dispatch the task.
The task result will be returned to the caller.
When called from inside a macro, the comsumer generated result is available for further use.

name: done
description:
Notifies completion of a task

Consumer API.
The tasker notifies completion of the given task to the server.
The tasker can optionally include a result or an error code.

name: register
description:
Registers a consumer

Consumer API.
Registers the current user resource as an available task consumer.
Tasks will be then dispatched to that consumer.

name: submit
description:
Submits a task

Producer API.
A task producer submits the given task to the server.
The server will find a tasker with processing capacity and dispatch the task.
The task result will be ignored : the producer will not receive any notification of any kind, even in case of errors (including capacity exceeded errors).
This verb will return immediately : you can use this API to asynchronously submit a task.

name: unregister
description:
Unregisters a consumer

Consumer API.
Unregisters the current user resource as an available task consumer.
All non finished tasks are returned to the server.

name: Notif
description:
Notification User API

User API for notifications.
For notifications to work properly, it is imperative that the resource name of a device remain constant over time.

name: DEFAULT_DEPLOYMENT_ID
description: Get default deployment id associated to Notif service

name: Rdbms
description:
RDBMS User API

User API for SQL queries.
Contrary to GDA or Stacks, the data are not stored on a per-user basis.
Users can store, get, list their data.

name: DEFAULT_DEPLOYMENT_ID
description: Get default deployment id associated to Rdbms service

name: Sms_ovh
description:
SMS service

User API for SMS.

name: DEFAULT_DEPLOYMENT_ID
description: Get default deployment id associated to Sms_ovh service

name: Cron
description:
User API for the Scheduler

User endpoints for scheduling : users can schedule, list and delete tasks.
Tasks are stored on a per-user basis: a task will run with the priviledges of the user who stored it.
Tasks are run on the server and thus can call api verbs marked as server-only.

name: DEFAULT_DEPLOYMENT_ID
description: Get default deployment id associated to Cron service

name: list
description:
List the configured tasks

Returns a paginated list of the asking user's tasks.

name: Search
description:
ElasticSearch Service

This API is a very thin wrapper around ElasticSearch's API.

name: DEFAULT_DEPLOYMENT_ID
description: Get default deployment id associated to Search service

name: delete
description:
Deletes data

Deletes a document from the elasticsearch engine by id.

name: get
description:
Gets data

Retrieves a document from the elasticsearch engine by id.

name: index
description:
Indexes data

Inserts or updates a document into the elasticsearch engine.

name: search
description: Searches for data

name: Template
description:
User API for templates

Users use this API to evaluate pre-configured templates.

name: DEFAULT_DEPLOYMENT_ID
description: Get default deployment id associated to Template service

name: evaluate
description:
Evaluates a template

Evaluates the given template and returns the result as a string.
Templates are parsed the first time they are evaluated. Evaluation may fail early due to a parsing error.

name: Trigger
description:
Trigger service

Register listeners and trigger events.

name: DEFAULT_DEPLOYMENT_ID
description: Get default deployment id associated to Trigger service

name: Zpfs_s3
description:
User API for file management

User API for virtual file management and http file upload
This API contains all the verbs needed to browse, upload and remove files.
Files are stored on a per-user basis: each user has his or her own whole virtual filesystem.
Uploading a file is a 3-step process : request an upload URL, upload via HTTP, notify this service of completion.

name: DEFAULT_DEPLOYMENT_ID
description: Get default deployment id associated to Zpfs_s3 service

name: cp
description:
Copies a file

Copies a file or folder (recursively) to a new location.
May fail if the target location is not empty.

name: du
description:
Returns disk usage

Returns an recursively aggregated number of used bytes, starting at the given path.

name: link
description:
Links a file

Links a file or folder to another location.
May fail if the target location is not empty.

name: ls
description:
Lists a folder content

Returns a paginated list of the folder's content.

name: mkdir
description:
Creates a folder

Creates a new folder.
May fail if the target location is not empty.

name: mv
description:
Moves a file

Moves a file or folder (recursively) to a new location.
May fail if the target location is not empty.

name: newFile
description:
Notifies of upload completion

The client application calls this verb to notify that it's done uploading to the cloud.
Calling that verb MAY trigger additional events such as thumbnail/metadata creation.

name: newUploadUrl
description:
Requests an upload URL

Requests an HTTP upload URL.
The URL contains temporary credentials (typically valid for a few minutes) and is meant for immediate use.

name: rm
description:
Removes a file

Removes a file or folder (recursively).

name: snapshot
description:
Creates a snapshot in a new folder

Creates a new folder and then copies the given files inside

name: stat
description:
Returns information about a file

Returns information about a single file.
The entry field will be null if the path does not exist

name: updateMeta
description: Updates a file's metadata

name: Zpfs_hdfs
description:
User API for local file management

User API for file content manipulation

name: DEFAULT_DEPLOYMENT_ID
description: Get default deployment id associated to Zpfs_hdfs service

name: cp
description:
Copies a file

Copies a file or folder (recursively) to a new location.
May fail if the target location is not empty.

name: du
description:
Returns disk usage

Returns an recursively aggregated number of used bytes, starting at the given path.

name: link
description:
Links a file

Links a file or folder to another location.
May fail if the target location is not empty.

name: ls
description:
Lists a folder content

Returns a paginated list of the folder's content.

name: mkdir
description:
Creates a folder

Creates a new folder.
May fail if the target location is not empty.

name: mv
description:
Moves a file

Moves a file or folder (recursively) to a new location.
May fail if the target location is not empty.

name: newFile
description:
Notifies of upload completion

The client application calls this verb to notify that it's done uploading to the cloud.
Calling that verb MAY trigger additional events such as thumbnail/metadata creation.

name: newUploadUrl
description:
Requests an upload URL

Requests an HTTP upload URL.
The URL contains temporary credentials (typically valid for a few minutes) and is meant for immediate use.

name: rm
description:
Removes a file

Removes a file or folder (recursively).

name: snapshot
description:
Creates a snapshot in a new folder

Creates a new folder and then copies the given files inside

name: stat
description:
Returns information about a file

Returns information about a single file.
The entry field will be null if the path does not exist

name: updateMeta
description: Updates a file's metadata

name: Zpfs_s3compat
description:
User API for file management

User API for virtual file management and http file upload
This API contains all the verbs needed to browse, upload and remove files.
Files are stored on a per-user basis: each user has his or her own whole virtual filesystem.
Uploading a file is a 3-step process : request an upload URL, upload via HTTP, notify this service of completion.

name: DEFAULT_DEPLOYMENT_ID
description: Get default deployment id associated to Zpfs_s3compat service

name: cp
description:
Copies a file

Copies a file or folder (recursively) to a new location.
May fail if the target location is not empty.

name: du
description:
Returns disk usage

Returns an recursively aggregated number of used bytes, starting at the given path.

name: link
description:
Links a file

Links a file or folder to another location.
May fail if the target location is not empty.

name: ls
description:
Lists a folder content

Returns a paginated list of the folder's content.

name: mkdir
description:
Creates a folder

Creates a new folder.
May fail if the target location is not empty.

name: mv
description:
Moves a file

Moves a file or folder (recursively) to a new location.
May fail if the target location is not empty.

name: newFile
description:
Notifies of upload completion

The client application calls this verb to notify that it's done uploading to the cloud.
Calling that verb MAY trigger additional events such as thumbnail/metadata creation.

name: newUploadUrl
description:
Requests an upload URL

Requests an HTTP upload URL.
The URL contains temporary credentials (typically valid for a few minutes) and is meant for immediate use.

name: rm
description:
Removes a file

Removes a file or folder (recursively).

name: snapshot
description:
Creates a snapshot in a new folder

Creates a new folder and then copies the given files inside

name: stat
description:
Returns information about a file

Returns information about a single file.
The entry field will be null if the path does not exist

name: updateMeta
description: Updates a file's metadata

name: Userdir
description: User API for user information

name: DEFAULT_DEPLOYMENT_ID
description: Get default deployment id associated to Userdir service

name: search
description: Searches for users matching the request

name: userInfo
description: Requests public data for the specified users

name: src/utils/index.js
HTTP_PATTERN
description: Match unsecure pattern web

name: HTTP_PROTOCOL
description: Http protocol

name: HTTPS_PROTOCOL
description: Https protocol

name: DICTIONARY
description: Alpha numeric dictionary

name: API_URL
description: Default ZetaPush API URL

name: FORCE_HTTPS
description:
Force ssl based protocol for network echange
Cross Env (Browser/Node) test

types: {apiUrl: string, sandboxId: string, forceHttps: boolean, transports: Transports}
params.name: parameters

name: uuid
description: Get random id

name: src/utils/session-persistence.js
SessionPersistenceStrategy
description: Provide abstraction for token persistence

name: src/utils/storage.js
MemoryStorage
description: Provide fallback for DOMStorage

name: ./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "zetapush-js",
  "version": "3.3.0",
  "description": "JavaScript SDK for ZetaPush",
  "browser": "dist/zetapush.js",
  "main": "lib/index.js",
  "module": "es/index.js",
  "jsnext:main": "es/index.js",
  "typings": "index.d.ts",
  "homepage": "http://zetapush.com",
  "bugs": "https://github.com/zetapush/zetapush-js/issues",
  "files": [
    "dist",
    "lib",
    "es",
    "src",
    "index.d.ts"
  ],
  "keywords": [
    "zetapush",
    "realtime",
    "sdk",
    "websocket",
    "long-polling"
  ],
  "license": "MIT",
  "contributors": [
    "Grgory Houllier",
    "Mikael Morvan"
  ],
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "git@github.com:zetapush/zetapush-js.git"
  },
  "scripts": {
    "lint": "eslint src",
    "clean": "rimraf lib dist es .deploy .esdoc",
    "build:commonjs": "cross-env BABEL_ENV=commonjs babel src --out-dir lib",
    "build:es": "cross-env BABEL_ENV=es babel src --out-dir es",
    "build:umd": "cross-env BABEL_ENV=umd NODE_ENV=development rollup -c -i src/index.js -o dist/zetapush.js",
    "build:umd:min": "cross-env BABEL_ENV=umd NODE_ENV=production rollup -c -i src/index.js -o dist/zetapush.min.js",
    "build": "yarn run build:commonjs && yarn run build:es && yarn run build:umd && yarn run build:umd:min",
    "prepublish": "yarn run clean && yarn run lint && yarn run build && yarn test:ci",
    "doc": "esdoc -c esdoc.json",
    "deploy:github": "yarn run doc && gulp deploy:github",
    "serve": "lr-http-server -d ./ -w ./dist/*.js,./examples/**/*.js,./examples/**/*.html -p 2600 -l 26001",
    "test:ci": "karma start karma.conf.js"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "zetapush-cometd": "3.2.0"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "babel-cli": "^6.26.0",
    "babel-core": "^6.26.0",
    "babel-eslint": "^8.0.1",
    "babel-plugin-external-helpers": "^6.22.0",
    "babel-preset-env": "^1.6.1",
    "cross-env": "^5.1.1",
    "esdoc": "^1.0.3",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "eslint": "^4.10.0",
    "eslint-config-standard": "^10.2.1",
    "eslint-plugin-import": "^2.8.0",
    "eslint-plugin-node": "^5.2.1",
    "eslint-plugin-promise": "^3.6.0",
    "eslint-plugin-standard": "^3.0.1",
    "gulp": "^3.9.1",
    "gulp-gh-pages": "^0.5.4",
    "jasmine-core": "^2.8.0",
    "karma": "^1.7.1",
    "karma-chrome-launcher": "^2.2.0",
    "karma-cli": "^1.0.1",
    "karma-jasmine": "^1.1.0",
    "lr-http-server": "^0.1.5",
    "request": "^2.83.0",
    "rimraf": "^2.6.2",
    "rollup": "^0.50.0",
    "rollup-plugin-babel": "^3.0.2",
    "rollup-plugin-commonjs": "^8.2.6",
    "rollup-plugin-json": "^2.3.0",
    "rollup-plugin-node-resolve": "^3.0.0",
    "rollup-plugin-uglify": "^2.0.1",
    "rollup-watch": "^4.3.1",
    "typescript": "^2.6.1"
  },
  "engines": {
    "node": ">=6"
  }
}
name: package.json

content: # zetapush-js
name: ./docs/index.md
./CHANGELOG.md
content:
# 3.3.0 (2017-11-02)

# Fix

* **typescript** Remove unsupported default parameters in typed definition

### Features

* **bower** Remove bower support
* **client** Support custom deployment for SmartClient (#8)

# 3.2.2 (2017-11-02)

> Fix issus on previously published version

# 3.2.1 (2017-11-02)

### Features

* **client** Update TS definition to support optionnal parameters in publish method

# 3.2.0 (2017-10-06)

### Features

* **client** Add new getUserInfo() method to retreive user public info

```js
const { Authentication, Client } = require('zetapush-js')
// Create new ZetaPush Client
const client = new Client({
  sandboxId: '<YOUR-SANDBOX-ID>',
  authentication: () => Authentication.simple({
    login: '<YOUR-USER-LOGIN>',
    password: '<YOUR-USER-PASSWORD>'
  })
})
// Add connection establised listener
client.onConnectionEstablished(() => {
  console.log('onConnectionEstablished')
  const profile = client.getUserInfo()
  console.log('Your profile', profile)
})
client.connect()
```

* **node** Support node execution context

```js
const { WeakClient } = require('zetapush-js')
const NodeJSTransports = require('zetapush-cometd/lib/node/Transports')
// Create new ZetaPush Client
const client = new WeakClient({
  transports: NodeJSTransports,
  sandboxId: '<YOUR-SANDBOX-ID>'
})
// Add connection establised listener
client.onConnectionEstablished(() => {
  console.log('onConnectionEstablished')
})
client.connect()
```

* **client** Add new lifecycle handler onNegotiationFailed

### Changes

* **core** Reduce bundle size
* **core** From webpack@2 to rollup
* **client** Update TransportLayer implementation
* **zetapush-cometd** Update TransportLayer implementation

# 3.1.3 (2017-04-13)

### Fix

* **typescript** Fix TypeScript issues

# 3.1.2 (2017-04-13)

### Features

* **typescript** Add TypeScript support

# 3.1.1 (2017-04-10)

### Features

* **client** Normalize apiUrl

# 3.1.0 (2017-02-21)

### Features

* **client** Add new connection callback onNoServerUrlAvailable
* **client** Add new connection callback onConnectionToServerFail
* **client** Add getServers method to expose server urls
* **client** Add createAsyncMacroService method to provide promise based macro services instance
* **internal** Improve code separation to support tree shaking

### Fixes

* **persistence** Catch SessionPersistenceStrategy error in private navigation mode

# 3.1.0-alpha.9 (2017-01-18)

* **persistence** Catch SessionPersistenceStrategy error in private navigation mode

# 3.0.1 (2017-01-18)

### Fixes

* **persistence** Catch SessionPersistenceStrategy error in private navigation mode

# 3.1.0-alpha.8 (2017-01-09)

* **chore** Upgrade eslint dependency to 3.13.0

# 3.1.0-alpha.7 (2017-01-09)

* **env** Update engines directive to "node": ">=6"

# 3.1.0-alpha.6 (2017-01-02)

* **client** Add new connection callback onNoServerUrlAvailable

# 3.1.0-alpha.5 (2017-01-02)

* **client** Add new connection callback onConnectionToServerFail

# 3.1.0-alpha.4 (2017-01-02)

* **npm** Bump to alpha.4 to avoid npm conflict

# 3.1.0-alpha.3 (2017-01-02)

* **client** Add getServers method to expose server urls

# 3.1.0-alpha.2 (2016-11-14)

* **internal** Improve code separation to support tree shaking

# 3.1.0-alpha.1 (2016-11-04)

* **client** Add createAsyncMacroService method to provide promise based macro services instance

### Features

# 3.0.0 (2016-10-24)

### Changes

* **client** Rename createService parameter from type to Type
* **core:** Update lib/client, rename credentials to authentication

### Fixes

* **smart-client** Fix sessions persistence key generation

### Features

* **core** Add lib/smart-client
* **test** ZetaPush core functionalities are now tested with Karma/Jasmine

# 3.0.0-alpha.3 (2016-09-16)

Major API modification

### BREAKING CHANGES

* **client** Rename createService parameter from type to Type

**Before**

```js
// Create new service
const service = new client.createService({
  type: ZetaPush.services.Stack,
  listener: {
    list(message) {
      console.log('on list', message)
    }
  }
})
```

**After**

```js
// Create new service
const service = new client.createService({
  Type: ZetaPush.services.Stack,
  listener: {
    list(message) {
      console.log('on list', message)
    }
  }
})
```

# 3.0.0-alpha.2 (2016-09-06)

### Fix

* **smart-client** Fix sessions persistence key generation

# 3.0.0-alpha.1 (2016-08-19)

Major API modification

### BREAKING CHANGES

* **core:** Update lib/client, rename credentials to authentication

**Before**

```js
// Create new ZetaPush Client
const client = new ZetaPush.Client({
  sandboxId: '<YOUR-SANDBOX-ID>',
  credentials() {
    return ZetaPush.AuthentFactory.createWeakHandshake({
      token: null
    })
  }
})
```

**After**

```js
// Create new ZetaPush Client
const client = new ZetaPush.Client({
  sandboxId: '<YOUR-SANDBOX-ID>',
  authentication() {
    return ZetaPush.Authentication.weak({
      token: null
    })
  }
})
```

### Features

* **core** Add lib/smart-client
* **test** ZetaPush core functionalities are now tested with Karma/Jasmine

# 2.0.1 (2016-07-26)

### Fixes

* **cometd** Update cometd to 3.0.13 to fix network overflow on handshake failure with reconnect advice

# 2.0.0 (2016-07-25)

:tada: After a complete refactoring, ZetaPush 2.0 is production ready

# 2.0.0-rc.3 (2016-07-15)

### Fixes

* **build** Improve build support with babel-plugin-transform-runtime

# 2.0.0-rc.2 (2016-07-13)

### Features

* **core:** Update lib/client, add new transports option
* **core:** Update lib/weak-client, add new transports option

```js
const client = new ZetaPush.WeakClient({
  sandboxId: 'Y1k3xBDc',
  transports: [ZetaPush.TransportTypes.LONG_POLLING]
})
```

# 2.0.0-rc.1 (2016-07-12)

Major API modification

### BREAKING CHANGES

* **core:** Update lib/authentication/handshake

**Before**

```js
// Create new ZetaPush Client
const client = new ZetaPush.Client({
  sandboxId: '<YOUR-SANDBOX-ID>',
  credentials() {
    return ZetaPush.AuthentFactory.createWeakHandshake({
      token: null
    })
  }
})
```

**After**

```js
// Create new ZetaPush Client
const client = new ZetaPush.Client({
  sandboxId: '<YOUR-SANDBOX-ID>',
  credentials() {
    return ZetaPush.Authentication.weak({
      token: null
    })
  }
})
```

# 2.0.0-beta.23 (2016-07-08)

### Fixes

* **client** Expose user Id

# 2.0.0-beta.22 (2016-07-07)

### Changes

* **tools** Build file is now generated via webpack instead of gulp

# 2.0.0-beta.21 (2016-07-05)

### Fixes

* **stand by** Update cometd version version to fix stand by bug

# 2.0.0-beta.20 (2016-07-05)

### Changes

* **log** Replace console.log in source code by cometd log layer
* **examples** Update examples with new **zetapush.min.js** file name

# 2.0.0-beta.19 (2016-07-04)

### Changes

* **dist** Add suffix min to build file

# 2.0.0-beta.18 (2016-06-21)

Major API modification

### BREAKING CHANGES

* **core:** Update lib/client.constructor()

**Before**

```js
// Create new ZetaPush Client
const client = new ZetaPush.Client({
  sandboxId: '<YOUR-SANDBOX-ID>',
  handshakeStrategy() {
    return ZetaPush.AuthentFactory.createWeakHandshake({
      token: null
    })
  }
})
```

**After**

```js
// Create new ZetaPush Client
const client = new ZetaPush.Client({
  sandboxId: '<YOUR-SANDBOX-ID>',
  credentials() {
    return ZetaPush.AuthentFactory.createWeakHandshake({
      token: null
    })
  }
})
```

# 2.0.0-beta.17 (2016-06-20)

Major API simplification

### BREAKING CHANGES

* **core:** Update lib/client.createService()
* **core:** Update lib/client.unsubscribe()

**Before**

```js
const service = client.createService({
  type: ZetaPush.services.Stack,
  listener: {
    list(message) {
      console.log('on list stack', message.data)
    }
  }
})
service.publisher.list({
  stack: '<STACK-ID>'
})
```

**After**

```js
const service = client.createService({
  type: ZetaPush.services.Stack,
  listener: {
    list(message) {
      console.log('on list stack', message.data)
    }
  }
})
service.list({
  stack: '<STACK-ID>'
})
```

# 2.0.0-beta.16 (2016-06-06)

Major API simplification

### BREAKING CHANGES

* **core:** Add lib/client.createService()
* **core:** Remove lib/client.createMacroPublisher()
* **core:** Remove lib/client.createServicePublisher()
* **core:** Remove lib/client.getSessionId()
* **core:** Remove lib/client.subscribe()
* **core:** Remove lib/client.createMacroPublisherSubscriber()
* **core:** Remove lib/client.createServicePublisherSubscriber()
* **core:** Remove lib/client.handshake()
* **core:** Rename lib/definitions to lib/services

**Before**

```js
var service = client.createServicePublisherSubscriber({
  definition: ZetaPush.definitions.StackPublisherDefinition,
    list: function (message) {
      console.log('on list stack', message.data)
    }
  }
})
service.publisher.list({
  stack: '<STACK-ID>'
})
```

**After**

```js
const service = client.createService({
  type: ZetaPush.services.Stack,
  listener: {
    list(message) {
      console.log('on list stack', message.data)
    }
  }
})
service.publisher.list({
  stack: '<STACK-ID>'
})
```

# 2.0.0-beta.15 (2016-06-03)

### Changes

* **misc:** Update internal default deployment id

# 2.0.0-beta.14 (2016-06-01)

### Fix

* **security:** Update forceHttps implementation

# 2.0.0-beta.13 (2016-06-01)

### Fix

* **security:** Dont override forceHttps for WeakClient

# 2.0.0-beta.12 (2016-06-01)

### Changes

* **security:** Force HTTPS when location.protocol is HTTPS

# 2.0.0-beta.11 (2016-06-01)

### Changes

* **core:**  Add shorthand methods to handle lifecycle connection events

# 2.0.0-beta.10 (2016-06-01)

### Changes

* **core:** Use default deploymentId for all services and authentication

# 2.0.0-beta.9

### Changes

* **core:** Add new API setLogLevel

### Fix

* **doc:** Update bower install path

# 2.0.0-beta.8 (2016-05-23)

### Changes

* **core:** Use subscription queue to automatically reconnect subscription

# 2.0.0-beta.7 (2016-05-23)

### Fix

* **core:** Fix connection status listener index

# 2.0.0-beta.6 (2016-05-20)

### Changes

* **core:** Rename SmartClient to WeakClient

# 2.0.0-beta.4 (2016-05-20)

### Changes

* **core:** Add new API isConnected

# 2.0.0-beta.3 (2016-05-17)

### Changes

* **macro:** Allow hardFail and debug option for macro publisher

# 2.0.0-beta.2 (2016-05-09)

### Fix

* **dependencies:** Update npm dependencies

# 2.0.0-beta.1 (2016-05-09)

### Fix

* **dependencies:** Add zetapush-cometd as a dependency

# 2.0.0-beta.0 (2016-05-09)

### Changes

* **core:** Add new API unsubscribe

# 2.0.0-alpha.6 (2016-05-02)

### Changes

* **core:** Add new VERSION parameter
* **core:** Add new API removeConnectionStatusListener

# 2.0.0-alpha.5 (2016-04-29)

### Changes

* **connection:** Add new connection lifecycle onConnectionWillClose

# 2.0.0-alpha.4 (2016-04-28)

### Fixes

* **npm:** Clean npm files

# 2.0.0-alpha.3 (2016-04-28)

### Features

* **core:** Add createMacroPublisherSubscriber() API
* **core:** Rename createServicePublisherSubscriber() API
* **examples:** Add new examples

# 2.0.0-alpha.2 (2016-04-25)

### Features

* **core:** Expose SmartClient API
* **examples:** Add new api and app examples

# 2.0.0-alpha.1 (2016-04-05)

### Features

* **core:** Complete API rewrite

### BREAKING CHANGES

* 2.x API is no longer compatible with 1.X
